application.name: findrx
application.brief: Find and refine reseau points in a cube
application.description: This program will read in a cube and refine the positions of the Reseau points. It will also modify the cube's label so the Reseaus are matched with sub-pixel accuracy. The new reseau coordinate set is then set to "Refined", and the validity of the pixels that have nothing wrong will be set to 1.

history.change: Moved from utilities into mission categories
Modified the registration algorithm on edge and corner reseaus.
Changed call to Chip::Load because a scale factor was added to the method.
Updated to properly check AutoReg::Register()'s return status

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: The cube to be used to extract Reseau points from.

parameter.name: REGDEF
parameter.description: The template to use with the AutoReg class. Default will be maximum correlation function with a tolerance of 0.7, a search cube of 21x21 pixels, and a pattern cube of 9x9 pixels.

parameter.name: MARK
parameter.brief: Mark the reseaus with a centered white pixel?
parameter.description: This option will enable marking onto the cube file, writing a tiny white pixel in the center of the refined reseau. This is mostly used for testing purposes, but it can also be used for verification.
